page.title: 20CHELTENHAM IN BLOOM
page.content:
"BRITAIN IN BLOOM" COMPETITION
A town of many attractive{parks, } {gardens}and open spaces, Cheltenham was runner-up to Bath in the "Britain in Bloom" competition in 1984. Local traders, businesses and householders are encouraged to make gardens, terraces and window boxes colourful. The Borough Council Parks Department produce and plant 100,000{flowers}and shrubs by June. A further 50,000 plants are kept in reserve to replace those vandalised. Surplus plants are sold to the public to defray the annual expense. Throughout the year all main roads into Cheltenham reflect the dedicated efforts of this Department. The town has high hopes of capturing first place in this year's competition.
